channel.title: Why can't I login after i've portforwarded?

item.title: Why can't I login after i've portforwarded?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

YOU can’t login while others can’t? I must admit that is a weird error. Like splinter said, try 127.0.0.1, and make sure that you allow local incoming connections.

Read full topic
item.source: Why can't I login after i've portforwarded?

item.title: Why can't I login after i've portforwarded?
item.dc:creator: @splinter-x splinter-x
item.description:
@splinter-x wrote:

Try this: >>>>Client sided<<< Change "revolutionx.zapto.org" in the EGUI to "127.0.0.1" Change all 3 of them that you put in the client to that and it should work.

Read full topic

item.title: Why can't I login after i've portforwarded?
item.dc:creator: @James-RevolutionX James-RevolutionX
item.description:
@James-RevolutionX wrote:

I’ve portforwarded, checked ports OPEN Udp and Tcp

Other people can login I can’t.

When I login it says invalid loginserver requested or to many connections from my address
I’m useing Deltascape as my Base.

This is what i’ve done (Source folder ->server)

  • connectingHost.startsWith(“localhost”) ||
    * connectingHost.equals(“revolutionx.zapto.org”)
    */true) {
    if (connectingHost.contains(“74-129-182-147.dhcp.insightbb.com”)) {
    misc.println(“Checking Server Status…”);

(client folder -> EGUI)

client.main(new String[] {
“revolutionx.zapto.org”, “revolutionx.zapto.org”, “revolutionx.zapto.org”

(Source folder -> client)

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“James”) && !connectedFrom.equals(“revolutionx.zapto.org”) && !connectedFrom.startsWith(“adsl-99”)){

I look at cmd it says not from local host
